page.title: 11THE CHURCH IN ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: Situated at the junction of the Lockerbie and Ettrick-Selkirk roads Eskdalemuir church built in 1826 is a linked charge with the neighbouring parish of Hutton and Corrie. With a membership rol of 70. Church services are held each Sunday at 12:30. The congrgation is small but dedicated and is served by eight elders , four of them women .he church contains a beautiful pipe organ. 1985 saw the celebration of the 75th Anniversary of the Church of Scotland's Womens Guild in Eskdalemuir ,the dedication of a Pulpit Fall given by the Guild, and the gathering of parishioners on a hillside by the tomb of the martyred Andrew Hislop to mark the 300th anniversary of the murder of this Covenanter.A sponsored walk through the forest and tea on the air striptook place in aid of church funds
